Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok....Ive stayed in plenty of hotels, but this one ranks somewhere else besides "dump". Here are a few things that we dealt with during our one week stay. 1) Elevator up to room sounded like it was going to explode the day we arrived, used stairs the rest of the week (see last comment) 2) Roll away for son was a sleeping bowl with mattress. Sent it back and waited 2 hours for a new one. Maid shows up with roll away with no pillows, sheets, blankets. Wait another hour for bedding. 3) 2 burnt out lites in room 4) toilet will not flush 5) bathroom door will not close 6) holes in walls 7) tv wouldnt stay on or would come on by itself and change channels when it deemed appropriate 8) daily charge for phone use, did not notice this until getting into the room. No matter if you use the phone or not. BS 9) take a shower before 10am or no hot water 10) last day of stay, we had no hot water 11) last night of stay, someone got stuck in bad elevator. Parking for this hotel is horrible since there is only one way in and one way out. They have limited the access to the parking lot because of the water park next door. In this case, because the fire trucks were there to rescue the person in the elevator, the trucks blocked the only way in and out of the hotel. We had to park in the front parking for Shoneys. If you can afford an extra $10 a nite, sleep somewhere else. This place was a DUMP

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at if you are on a budget and want to spend money at attractions and not on a hotel. This hotel was very clean, friendly staff and ina GREAT location. We paid about 25 a night and it was well worth it. We were not looking to pay a huge amount for rooms, but we wanted a clean and safe room and thats what we got. Nice clean pool area and room was cleaned every day. Will stay here again!! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: scottishgirl83
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 14 night stay at the country hearth inn and suites, previously known as the park inn and suites. After reading reviews on here we were worried but we arrived to lovely pleasant staff who were helpful, check in was fast and simple. Our room was absolutely spotless, didn't have any faults with it at all. Pool area was clean, quiet during the day but got busier at nights. Shoney's restaurant was onsite and handy for early morning breakfast before heading to the parks, we didnt try other meals here as the hotel is in easy walking distance of a number of fast food chains and restaurants to suit most tastes. 5/10 minute walk into Old Town, next door to stores, plenty of souvenir shops locally as well as a supermarket in both directions along 192. Would consider going back here as it was good value for money. Couldn't expect more for a hotel of such a rating.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and Plunging Toilets”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are originally from Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, and we stayed at the Park Inn and Suites Maingate East in Orlando from March 30 - April 6. There is much to tell but I will attempt to be short. Beginning assumptions: We expected this place to be a clean room for us to sleep in at night - nothing more - as we were obviously not expecting a 5 star resort in a 2 star hotel. Checking in: We waited for 1 hour in the lobby while the one receptionist was trying to put us into our room. The receptionist told us that the hotel had overbooked. After visiting the public washroom in the lobby, I sincerely hoped that they would move us to another hotel. Unfortunately, no such luck. Eventually at midnight, the receptionist "found" a room and away we went. The elevators: Don't look at the spalling plastic and hold your breath. Otherwise your lungs will suffer from the wonderful aroma of mold and urine. (The floor of the elevator is carpeted) The first room: As we entered the room, we were overcome by the stench of mold and mildew. The smell was so overpowering, and I being allergic to mold and mildew, there was no way we could stand it. My husband went back to the reception area. Of course there were no rooms, apparently no rooms in any of the other Orlando hotels, which meant no transfer. It turned out that our only option was to get an uncleaned room. The cleaning staff: Work only from 8am until sometime in the early afternoon. They are not available in the evenings or nights. The second room: This room, even though not cleaned from the previous resident, smelled normal. From the comments that we read previously on this website, I think this room must have been in the newer wing. Since the stench from the previous room had been so bad, we felt glad to have finally a place. We couldn't flush the toilet and called the reception. They sent a guy to plunge the toilet. He left the plunger... The cleaning job: Don't expect the cleaning staff to vacuum the room. It was never vacuumed after the previous resident and was never vacuumed during our entire stay despite many phone calls and visits to the reception. We didn't ever get any more toilet paper, tissue paper, soap, coffee, or cups. We had to pick these up at the front desk when we came home every night. The toilet: The toilet would half-flush if you went for a #1 and no toilet paper. It would get completely blocked and overflow if you needed to go for a #2 or if you wished to use any amount of toilet paper. We called in to the reception again to "fix" our toilet. The guy came again and plunged it. He then went on to explain that this was normal as they fitted newer and smaller water tanks to the toilets (thus less water to flush with) and that the blockage somewhere in the pipes would have to be removed once we were gone. "You'll just have to live with it for the week" he told us. We used our toilet as sparingly as we could from then on and mastered the art of toilet plunging. I included a photo of my dear husband during one of the many toilet plunges. The cockroaches: Oh Yes! We had 'em by the dozens! We discovered this treat while we were eating back in our room. Everywhere. Crawling around the fridge, peeking out from around the TV, on the floor eating last month's leftovers... Being from Canada, I have never seen a cockroach before, but my savvy husband being originally from a tropical country, knew right as soon he saw them. They can jump, fly short distances and are quick as lightening. You have to be very careful about these little monsters as they can spread nasty stuff if they get into your food. Since I'm pregnant, and justly worried about toxoplasmosis that these little critters can spread, we called in to get another room, hoping that one would become available. No luck - we were offered the same moldy room in the old wing again. I figured I would take my chances of getting a disease rather than getting a fatal allergy attack. We did get a couple of pictures of these guys before they suffered an untimely death. One is crawling on the fridge lip and the other is right by the TV. The pool: Smaller than it looks in the pictures. You will enjoy floaties of many different origins. As this is a cheap hotel, there are obviously going to be many families. So just expect to get spashed by kids at any time of the day. The "breakfast": I think they now have a little more honest description on their website. They had apples, small cheap granola bars and "coffee" with milk-free creamers when we were there at 6:30am when the "breakfast" started. Don't expect it to be a breakfast. Go to the grocery store and buy some supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has basic clean rooms. I did not find the dirt on the floor like some previous people listed on here. Everyone who worked at the hotel was very friendly. This hotel is in an EXCELLENT location. It is the closest budget hotel to Disney World. It is an older property but a great place to stay at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Park Inn and Suites Orlando Maingate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn and Suites at Maingate in Orlando was average. The room was clean, but the over all appearance was not exceptional. Contiental Breakfast consisted of apples, granola bars, and coffee. No Juice, bagels, or other fruit. People at the front desk were very friendly, and willing to help. Hotel would be fine for someone looking for a basic place to lay their head. No frills.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week and had very poor service, we had a bathtub that leaked constrantly, and when taking a shower you would have 5 inches of water build up. Our phone had a bad crackling sound, and had to ask 4 times to have it fixed. We did not receive a blue book that told you about the hotel etc... and charges. When we checked out we were told we had to pay for some calls that were local, but when we checked in that was the first thing I asked if we get charged for this. You don't if you are in Kissimmee, but if you call Orlando you get charge even though it is still local. I have stayed in many placed, Mexico, Cuba, etc... And they were better then this hotel/motel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, nor would I go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “where did you stay people???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 nights at the Park Inn, before i got there i looked at the reviews and was pretty scared. So took the car at the airport, drove down to park inn, found a very friendly person at the desk, set me up with a room facing the pool, got to the room opened the door and had a lovely stay. The room was clean, everything was working, the pool was warm and clean, the jacuzzi was hot and working...so i just don t understand the poor rating, i ve been traveling a lot, this is not a westin resort Hotel, for sure, but it s not 300 a night!!!. For the price, you get a lot for your money believe me. Had a very good service, the ac was working just fine, rooom was cleaned everyday, the hotel is very well located, the beds were very clean and comfy. There is no real breakfast included but had a coffee machine, a freezer and microwave, just took a little stuff from Publix and was fine all week. People that give a poor rating don t know how to travel, next time go directly to disney...pay 250 a night for 8 hours of sleep and enjoy your trip...this is a very good value hotel, don t hesitate!!!!enjoy orlando!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrid experience Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am not a choosy traveller and will put up with a lot This place was recommended by Sears travel so we went Changed rooms 3 times but final room was really below par missing or broken items in every room (including the door lock) missing shower head dirty dirty apparently the newer tower is better but we were not allowed there , even though there were lots of empty rooms due to off-season (I guess their cheap rates just get you the cheap rooms) pool was brown filthy water and garbage piled around there and around outbuildings 1 washer in the complex worked and had to locate a working dryer in another building But the best the laugh riot our continental breakfast was stale bread (their toaster not functioning) and 1 morning of our stay stale plain donuts lousy juice and coffee I love camping and roughing it but these accomodations were worse than camping Complaints about hotel were ignored until Sears helped and then only a $50.00 credit (Do they really think I would ever go back?) laughable

Reviews.Title: “O.K for the price”
Reviews.Author: Arielitoll
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Park Inn and Suites and I thought it was ok. We had a suite for $80.00 dollars a night which was not bad for what we got. To start off checking in was pretty easy and the staff was very courteous. Once we entered the suite we noticed there was only 1 shower tower on the tower rack. So, my dad had to go down to the lobby to ask for towels. After about 20 min later, someone arrived with them. The suite included a living room, a very small kitchen and 3 t.v's. In the bedroom there is a king sized bed and in the little kids parlor there is two twin bunk beds which were a lot bigger than I thought. We previously stayed here in 2000 and had a standard room which was nice. The only thing the suite did not have was an eating table. The standard rooms usually come with a table for two to four people. This suite didn't come with a table for you to sit down and have breakfast or a quick meal of some kind. The hotel has a very nice pool with a jacuzzi next to it. This hotel is made up of 2 towers. The first time we came to this hotel 4 years ago we stayed in the new building which is behind the building we just stayed in. This place also includes a Shoneys which I thought was excellent. This place overall was good especially for the price we got.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Adrie v
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with our suite. It was comfortable and clean and had 3(!) TV's. Pool is a bit small but OK. Would recommend it to anybody. We paid $ 89 per night in August 2004 A3

Reviews.Title: “Prepaid room, not available. Cricket & Roaches. Mildew and cigarette odor.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Aug 20-22, 2004. When we arrived at the front desk the night of the 22nd we discovered that they had severely overbooked the hotel and they did not have a room for us (prepaid through Hotwire). After 45 minutes they sent us to another hotel with a letter-voucher to be presented to the front desk for payment. We drove 6 miles to the next hotel to discover that they would not accept the letter plus they only had smoking rooms, unacceptable for us since we were traveling with our baby daughter. We went back to the Park Inn and after 15 minutes or so it turned our that they had rooms available, they were reserved for some police members staying there helping on Hurricane Charley matters. The rooms were RESERVED but nobody had claimed the reservations therefore they were AVAILABLE to be used. We got to the room which had a hideous smell of cigarette smoke and mold. And to top things off, there was a cricket chirping through the night, it sounded as being inside the room right next to the A/C unit. The next morning the key would not work, plus there were roaches coming from under the microvave oven. I asked to be moved to another room and they said that there were none available. They promised to check on the cricket and changed the room lock. That second night.. the cricket was still there. A nightmare of a place!

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if you like dirt.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Inn yesterday May 31. 2004. Don't believe anything their webpage promises! The Park Inn & Suites Orlando Maingate East is in a very sad shape. Requested a non-smoking room, got a heavy deoderized room with an ashtry provided. If I don't smoke it becomes a non-smoking room? Room 100 was very dirty. How dirty? Take a shower and walk to the bed and your feet are so black that they stain the sheets of the bed. Is there more to say? Front desk personel is argumentive, maides do their job as they were told to do, manager hides and will not contact you.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Family Hotel with just the basics...very close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There seems to be many negative reviews here concerning this hotel, however the quantity of the poor reviews and the fact that many are written quickly I would imagine someone is writing multiple reviews with an axe to grid. I personally stayed at the Park Inn (formerly the Larson Inn) three times over the last 6 years and have a radically different opinion of the facilities and it's staff. First off you have to understand that this is a TWO star hotel...so if you expect to pay for a TWO star and receive FIVE star service and amenities then you're setting yourself up for a fall. For what it is, the Park Inn is a decent no-frills place to stay for couples or families who have their feet on the ground. Prior to my arrival I emailed the hotel on both occasions and made my "requests" for a non-smoking room facing the pool on any floor. Simple request really but one that was messed up last year by the staff at the Quality Inn on International Drive. In both instances the room I requested was ready for me when I arrived for check-in. The front desk greeter was of the spanish persuasion and her English a little broken, but nothing that an anglophone Canadian couldn't comprehend. She was very personable, helpful and polite. Our room was very clean when we opened the door, however I noticed that the sink-stopper in the bathroom was not functioning properly. 15 minutes after informing the front desk, a very friendly maintenance man arrived at our door and resolved the problem in about 5 minutes. On our second days stay (of 7) the cleaning staff failed to give us enough towels and flannels for the evening. After a quick phone complaint, when we returned the following day from a Disney all-nighter there were enough towels in the bathroom for at least 2 days and they were replenished this way for the duration of our stay. The pool area and jacuzzi are moderate in size but situated perfectly between the two towers of the hotel complex. The pool area is kept very clean, and the jacuzzi was comfortable and terrific. Pool staff were always willing to turn a blind eye (at a polite request) to extending the hours of the pool for a little while longer which was nice when you returned so late from the parks. If you're not into a short walk to the front desk you might be put off by the distance from the back building...however I enjoyed a morning walk to the front desk. The property is well maintained and the layout is okay. I would repaint the metal supports of the canopy leading from the hotel area to the lobby as the peeling rust paint could be a put off for some people. Each room is equipped with a wall safe, coffee maker (first replenishment free, you have to buy more at the gift shop if you want it), and a small bar-fridge and microwave. Rooms are actually cleaned daily (again no horror stories for us) and all requests were met with understanding and efficiency. The carpets and bedclothes are a little dated in style but I experienced no horror-story problems with cleanliness of the sheets and did not feel compeled to "sleep in my car" like some of the previous reviewers. If there is anything to complain about at this hotel it's some of the people who stay there. On our first trip there were no problems at all with other vacationers, however on the second trip we had a 10 - 15 person family in about 3 ajoining rooms staying beside us for about 3 nights who were right out of the cast of "deliverance" or the infield of a NASCAR race. Loud music, people hanging their laundry (not just a few towels) on the balcony, moving upholstered chairs into the walkways and the sound of beer cans being popped open until the late hours. I was compeled to say something but I'm sure there were shotguns in the Budweiser filled pickup in the parking lot so I remained silent. There was also a VERY large bodied man who chose to wear a VERY small tiger-striped speedo in the jacuzzi and pool for a few days, but beyond scaring a few small children this was more a laugh than anything else. The hotel is perfectly situated at the corner of Hwy 192 & Hwy 4 less than 10 minutes to Disneyworld and about 20 minutes from Universal. A continental breakfast is supplied daily, but you have to be up with the fishermen to get something, as after 9am most everything is gone, however coffee and juices are usually there. A Shoney's restaurant is built into the front of the hotel however the prices were a little high compared with Denny's or Ponderosa so we chose to drive down Hwy 192 for eats. Hwy 192 in Kissimee is a neverending (almost) strip of hotels and restaurants to match any tastes...do yourself a favour and pick up quite a few of the "tourist" newsletters, maps and magazines...these are loaded with coupons for almost every small attraction of food place in Orlando/Kissimee...If you're a race fan check out Race Rock on International drive...amazing place and good food too! Watermania (family sized waterpark) is literally right across the road from the hotel and our package included free 7 days access although we never took advantage of it as we were too busy elsewhere, however this would be a treat for those with children...check your tour operator for availability. If you're planning on doing Disney and any of the other parks for the majority of your vacation then this is a perfectly safe, convenient and clean place to "sleep" overnight and for a few nice mornings or evenings in the pool. If you want (expect) more than the basics though, pay the extra and stay elsewhere...choose your hotel to match your expectations rather than your budget and you'll be much happier with your vacation. I would definately consider staying at this hotel again in future if I were travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Our Experience was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand the negative reviews of this property. My husband and I stayed at the Park Inn for our anniversary vacation the first of April and we were pleased from the time we checked in until we checked out. EVERYONE we had contact with was MORE than kind and accommodating. We had a late check in and arrived after midnight. The Night Auditor 'Ryan' was there to open the door and quickly got us checked into our room. We enjoyed the free breakfast (It WAS crowded but, I took coffee and donuts back to the room- we were more comfortable there anyway). The pool was REALLY nice and warm. I do need to note that the hot tub was not working properly (I think you could have cooked in there) but that was minor. Our room was cleaned daily (THOROUGHLY) and when we returned in the evenings, our bed was 'set' for us. Evey day, the maid had the bed turned down and had the pillows arranged 'artfully' on the bed. On our final day, I called the front desk to request a late checkout and the gentleman was very helpful and allowed us to spend a few last hours at the pool before we had to fly home. Would I stay here again - YOU BET!

Reviews.Title: “Please read before booking this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Carlson hospitality Worldwide,We would like to make a few notations that there was not room for on the survey card.1. We had a hard time speaking to the people at the front desk when we had a question when we called by phone. They did not speak English clear enough.2. we made our reservations via the Internet 6 months in advance knowing the Christmas season was busy. They were paid in full for 10 nights.We decided to stay an extra night and when my husband went to the front desk to extend our stay and pay full price up front for it. He told the woman we had been there for 10 nights she said "I don't miss my husband honey, why would I miss you." We were given the extension for the night. 3. We were not given a room like the one pictured on the Internet. We were given the brush off like we were "One of those" who reserved on the Internet. We were given a room that the tub had water trapped UNDER the tub. (between the tub liner and the floor.) my husband who is new home contruction still does not understand how this can happen. We mentioned this to the front desk and they brushed us off telling us that it would not seep into water if our children took a bath. Still, when mentioned that standing was difficult because of the wave effect the water had UNDER the tub, we were told to be "careful". 4. we were not entirely unhappy with the room. It , offered a small fridge and microwave, but the state of repair was discouraging:The turntable in the microwave was not working.the marks on the dresser were there for 4 days. I went ot eh store and got CLorox wipes and did it myself. I could only imagine how well the rest of the room was cleaned.The bedspread has some kind of brown stain on them. When asked housekeeping to replace, twice the person nodded, did not speak any English and "I will do" but it was not done.Half the hangars were missing from the closet area and we were told several times they would be replaced so we could hang some clothes up.The dryers did not work. I used FOUR cycles to dry some socks and underwear. When we asked the front desk if there was a Laundromat near he said "2nd and 4th floor". We said those appliances didn't work well. He just kept repeating "2nd and 4th floor". the only ice machine that worked in both buildings was on the bottom floor on the building furthest from the office. There were to be ice machines on all floors.We would consider staying again is we were assured that the "updating and remodeling was done to all rooms, and the staff was a little friendlier. Just because someone reserves a room from the Internet does not mean they are to be treated with less respect. Crystal, MN

HotelInfo.Name: Country Hearth Inn Maingate East
HotelInfo.Address: 6075 W Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy (Hwy 192), Kissimmee, FL 34747
